Might I suggest fully testing out each planet before considering it for release? I know it may sound crazy, but testing and making sure planets actually work would go a long way in stopping bug reports. When you are working on a planet don't just look at it from the map view or in orbit. Land on it, in several places, and fully make sure the planet is not bugged or acting weird. See if you can walk on it, test the gravity, ect. Once you know it's working as you intended then you should release, but not before.

look, amarius with all respect you need to properly test everything first before putting out a release. I can't even begin to count the hours I've spent testing New Horizons making sure everything works and even with all that effort small bugs still make it through. The same should be done with K+, the planets NEED to be thoroughly tested first otherwise there's no real point in releasing at all.

> 
> What you do is writing configs for mods, you don't code anything. Coding is a pretty hard job, and it takes some time to fully understand what you're doing, writing configs is pretty easy, and if you have some experience, you shouldn't even need to fix bugs, because either the config works out of the box, or you notice your issues while testing the config. I have to agree with Borisbee and Ashley: Test your configs before releasing them. It is a shame that a great mod is buggy as hell, because nobody checks the config, and releases get rushed out before they are properly tested. And honestly amarius: You can't complain that you have too many mods, I've seen people who maintain 10 mods or so and still have a job and a family. If you can't ensure, that your mods reach a specific level of quality, let someone else maintain them. But, if you really want to maintain them all, you can't use this as an excuse for your faults, and you need to make sure, that your mods are playable. Otherwise, I'd suggest to remove all Download-Links, put "[Heavy WIP]" in the title and to move this to Addon-Dev until you can fix EVERY single bug with the configs, because I've already got PM's from users who think that Kopernicus would break KerbolPlus, and that annoys me.

A PQS mod is a modofocation, like a mini mod that goes into kopernicus konfigs to form planets. They have many complex but helpfull paramiters. For example, the VertexColorMap gives the planet the color you see from the surface, or the LandControl PQS mod that makes possible custom ground scatter

Second half of this video is Mu explaining PQS and PQSMods.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mXTxQko-JH0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

(PQSMods are how a plain sphere, PQS alone, gets turned into actual planetary terrain)
